question: A square is divided into 4 equal quadrants, with each quadrant labeled as follows: the top-left is white, the top-right is black, the bottom-left is black, and the bottom-right is white. If this square is reflected across a vertical line running through its center, what will be the resulting pattern? Describe which quadrants will be white and which will be black after the reflection.
answer:
When reflecting a square across a vertical line running through its center, each point in the square will be mapped to a corresponding point on the opposite side of the vertical line, at the same distance from the line.

Starting with our original pattern:
- Top-left quadrant: white
- Top-right quadrant: black
- Bottom-left quadrant: black
- Bottom-right quadrant: white

After reflection across the vertical line:
- The top-left quadrant (white) will be mapped to the top-right quadrant
- The top-right quadrant (black) will be mapped to the top-left quadrant
- The bottom-left quadrant (black) will be mapped to the bottom-right quadrant
- The bottom-right quadrant (white) will be mapped to the bottom-left quadrant

Therefore, the resulting pattern will be:
- Top-left quadrant: black
- Top-right quadrant: white
- Bottom-left quadrant: white
- Bottom-right quadrant: black

The reflection has essentially swapped the left and right sides of the square while preserving the positions relative to the horizontal axis.
